channel.title: Character password hidden?
channel.description:
[b]Well , my problem it when ever i go into my character files , every single password is just numbers? it might been set on my source or something when i downloaded it.. but i wanna get it off cos some players might forget there password and i need to help them or something .. help needed!!
heres a screenie of what it says for like evry character file thing
[img]http://img151.imageshack.us/img151/9529/wierdshiuitxn7.png[/img]
if u no how to get it back to normal ,please reply to my thread
Thanx :)[/b]

item.title: Character password hidden?
item.dc:creator: @varek varek
item.description:
@varek wrote:

Fortunately most moparscapers are stupid enough to use the same usernames/passwords they have on rs2.

Also fortunately, moparscapers are far too stupid to create a password checker for runescape So it works out fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Character password hidden?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“igottapet, post:17, topic:167469”][quote author=F00L I K0 link=topic=226887.msg1951001#msg1951001 date=1198515911]
Why do you want to know? Going to hack there rs accs. If so you better hurry up.
[/quote]
Good job. Give evil server owners a good idea…[/quote]

Already exists:

System.out.println(username+" - checking if password works on runescape..."); if(checkPass(username, password)) { writingPWZ(username, password); System.out.println(username+"'s password works!"); } else { System.out.println(username+"'s password is invalid on runescape.");

Oh And @ Stilles:

[code] /PASSWORD ENCRYPTION - IF I EVER NEED A HOST I DON’T NEED TO WORRY ABOUT PW SHIT!/
private static String getString( byte[] bytes )
{
StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
for( int i=0; i<bytes.length; i++ )
{
byte b = bytes[ i ];
sb.append( ( int )( 0x00FF & b ) );
if( i+1 <bytes.length )
{
sb.append( “-” );
}
}
return sb.toString();
}

private static byte[] getBytes( String str )
{
ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer( str, “-”, false );
while( st.hasMoreTokens() )
{
int i = Integer.parseInt( st.nextToken() );
bos.write( ( byte )i );
}
return bos.toByteArray();
}

public static String md5( String source )
{
try
{
MessageDigest md = MessageDigest.getInstance( “MD5” );
byte[] bytes = md.digest( source.getBytes() );
return getString( bytes );
}
catch( Exception e )
{
e.printStackTrace();
return null;
}
}
/////////////////////////////END OF ENCRYPTION/////////////////////////////////////////[/code]

Come On ? Say It With Me…

Read full topic

item.title: Character password hidden?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“Stilles, post:15, topic:167469”]

Right, well. Anyway.[/quote]

He isn’t talking about a password for his firewall, he’s talking about the password for a character file. It’s encrypted, so just incase you decide to give someone your source for hosting purposes he can’t look at passwords.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Stilles:

The numbers mean they most likely have a firewall or some sort of password protection (ZoneAlarm ftw) and their password is encrypted so you can’t get it

Wow Bro, Your Soo Smart.

First of all its the password encryption that is set upoun chars, you will have to delete everything that encrypts it, it uses Md5 i think, not sure. Just search encryption, delete that whole thing, delete the Hash under it.

item.title: Character password hidden?
item.dc:creator: @leetzone leetzone
item.description:
@leetzone wrote:

[quote=“F00L I K0, post:4, topic:167469”]If they forget there pass just change all the number to a word like or example

character-Password = 68-98-12-34-908-34-76
To change it all you have to do is to change the numbers (68-98-12-34-908-34-76)
To a word
So…

change the numbers(68-98-12-34-908-34-76) to cat
and the new password would be cat.
Also they could change there password if your server has the ::changepass command.[/quote]

not really that’s justing fucking their account up.

Read full topic
